author: glasser
msg: Add fs- and repos-level APIs to change multiple transaction properties
Rationale: Every normal commit starts by setting at least three
transaction properties, and in FSFS, this meant we were
doing an "open/read prop hash/close/open/write prop hash/close" dance
three times.  This API lets that operation happen just once per
commit.  (A small savings, but some (incredibly naive) application of
DTrace to the test suite seemed to show that the svnserve spent a huge
fraction of its time reading in txn props.)
Note that while I did implement this API for BDB as well, I just
implemented it as a loop calling the svn_fs_change_txn_prop (singular)
implementation; somebody who knows BDB better than me could try to
make its implementation only do one BDB transaction or whatever as
well, and also use it internally in place of the old API.
(Note that the new APIs put the properties in arrays, not hashes, so
that property deletion can be represented.)
(svn_fs_fs__change_txn_props): Implement new API using guts of the
(svn_fs_fs__change_txn_prop): Change into a wrapper around the new
(commit_body): Batch up the deletions of svn:check-locks,
svn:check-ood, and svn:contains-mergeinfo using the new API.
and svn:check-ood using the new API.
svn_repos_fs_change_txn_props and change to take an array instead
of a hash.  And move it later in the file.  (This is getting all
